snippet: The long-term agreement ends fighting over a controversial ad-skipping feature and includes advances in how digital television rights are handled.
abstract: Walt Disney Company and Dish sign long-term distribution deal that ends fighting over a controversial ad-skipping feature and includes advances in how digital television rights are handled; agreement is cheered by media analysts and investors, and is seen as a victory for both companies.
lead_paragraph: The long-term agreement ends fighting over a controversial ad-skipping feature and includes advances in how digital television rights are handled.

headline.main: Deal Between Dish and Disney Seen as a Win for Both
headline.print_headline: Dish and Disney Sign a Deal Viewed as a Victory for Both
